topic_metadata.title: How to ignore headers in CSV Files?

posts.name: Nichlas Hummelsberger
posts.cooked:
I am creating a document with tables using data from csv files.

These files also containes headers.

Is there a way I can define that the first few fields are part of the header, or maybe import the csv skipping the first line?
posts.raw:
I am creating a document with tables using data from csv files.

These files also containes headers.

Is there a way I can define that the first few fields are part of the header, or maybe import the csv skipping the first line?

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
Hello!

Don’t hesitate to formulate your post title as a question, as recommended in How to post in the Questions category! Hopefully that will help other people find your post faster.

You can either drop the first row , or use row-type: dictionary, giving you an array of dictionaries.

#csv("test.csv", row-type: dictionary)

#csv("test.csv", row-type: array)

#csv("test.csv", row-type: array).slice(1)
posts.raw:
Hello! 

Don't hesitate to formulate your post title as a question, as recommended in https://forum.typst.app/t/how-to-post-in-the-questions-category/11! Hopefully that will help other people find your post faster.

You can either drop the first row , or use [`row-type: dictionary`](https://typst.app/docs/reference/data-loading/csv/#parameters-row-type), giving you an array of dictionaries.

```typ
#csv("test.csv", row-type: dictionary)

#csv("test.csv", row-type: array)

#csv("test.csv", row-type: array).slice(1)
```
![image|381x286](upload://vDWlwkyi971i7p9auaTUuewNfce.png)

posts.name: Nichlas Hummelsberger
posts.cooked:
Looks like .slice(1) will do it for me!

Thanks!
posts.raw:
Looks like `.slice(1)` will do it for me!

Thanks!

posts.cooked:

For future posts, please make sure your title is a question you’d ask to a friend about Typst.
posts.raw:
